div.p: SALVE regina, among the Romaniſts, the name of a Latin prayer, addreſſed to the Virgin, and ſung after complines, as alſo upon the point of executing a criminal. Durandus ſays, it was compoſed by Peter biſhop of Compoſtella. The cuſtom of ſinging the ſalve regina at the cloſe of the office was begun by order of St Dominic, and firſt in the congregation of Dominicans at Bologna, about 1237. Gregory IX. firſt appointed it to be general. St Bernard added the concluſion, O duſcis! O pia, &c.
